excerpt: Criminal Minds, Poker Face, The Walking Dead: Dead City and more! Find out what's new, returning and leaving the small screen in the next seven days.

html:
To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, youâ€™ll find 10 new shows (including Miss Austen, The Motherhood and Star Wars: Tales of the Underworld), a dozen returning favorites (including Criminal Minds, Poker Face and The Walking Dead: Dead City), 15 finales (including the very last episodes of The Equalizer and The Righteous Gemstones) and more.

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email usÂ and your question may be answered in Mattâ€™s Inside Line.

SUNDAY, MAY 4

ðŸ“º Conan Oâ€™Brien: The Kennedy Center Mark Twain Prize for American Humor (Netflix special)
ðŸ“º The Last Anniversary limited series finale (AMC+)

ðŸ“º Star Wars: Tales of the Underworld (Disney+, six-episode binge)
Former assassin and bounty hunter Asajj Ventress is given a new chance at life and must go on the run with an unexpected new ally, while outlaw Cad Bane faces his past when he confronts an old friend, now a Marshal on the opposite side of the law.

ðŸ“º 9 pm Miss Austen (PBS)
The four-part series takes a literary mystery â€” Cassandra Austen (Keeley Hawes) notoriously burning her famous sister Janeâ€™s (Patsy Ferran) letters â€” and reimagines it as a story of sisterly love.

ðŸ“º 10 pm Toxic (Investigation Discovery)
The six-part docuseries follows Elizabeth Chambers as she draws from her experience and background as an investigative journalist to delve into the dark and twisted side of relationships.

TUESDAY, MAY 6

ðŸ“º Murder Has Two Faces (Hulu, three-episode binge)
Robin Roberts shines a social justice light on harrowing, lesser-known cases that were eclipsed in the media by more notorious murders.

ðŸ“º 8 pm Night Court Season 3 finale (NBC, two episodes, next day on Peacock)

From sideline meltdowns to schoolyard standoffs, and clashes with cops, coaches and even fellow parents, these viral moments reveal just how far moms and dads will go to defend their kids.

The Judy Blume adaptation tells the story of two Black teens (played by Lovie Simone and Michael Cooper Jr.) exploring romance and their identities through the awkward journey of being each otherâ€™s firsts.

Phoebe Waller-Bridge narrates this doc about one of the most intelligent and mysterious life forms on the planet.

A chilling 911 call. A gruesome scene. What is the real story behind Jason Corbettâ€™s brutal death? In this documentary, Jasonâ€™s wife and children reflect on the elusive truths behind their seemingly fairytale life.Â
